title.narrative: CROSS-SECTORAL APPROACHES

description.narrative: Strategies to address cross-cutting issues related to child rights are developed and applied., which contributes to Children With Disabilities, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development (Covid), Environmental Sustainability, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Sanitation, Sanitation (Covid), Supply And Logistics. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Country Programme is efficiently designed, coordinated, managed and supported to meet quality programming standards in achieving results for children

mailing-address.narrative: 19 Phra Athit Road Banglumpoo Pranakorn Bangkok 10200

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Strategies to address cross-cutting issues related to child rights are developed and applied.

description.narrative:
One thousand vulnerable families in Ubon Ratchathani received cash support from UNICEF, which allowed them to meet their most basic needs after experiencing the worst flood that the province experienced in 30 years.
Health workers in the Southern border provinces improved communication skills on immunization as a result of a UNICEF training in the sub-region where immunization coverage is low, advanced capacity to address issues such as vaccine hesitancy will help health workers to improve efficiency. Thailand was one of the countries around the world affected by the global measles outbreak, especially in the south, due to lower immunization coverage. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

Number of people reached with critical WASH supplies (including hygiene items) and services.
Number of children reached with targeted messages and information on COVID-19 on personal hygiene and improved sanitary practices (specific to schools and ECD centres).
Co-creation contest to promote innovative ideas organized as part of Generation Unlimited global initiative

Availability of Sub-National Administrative structures of the Ministry of Interior to advance inclusive child and youth development, protection and meaningful participation. Level 1 Mapping of programmes related to children and youth completed. Level 2 - Draft framework available with feedback from MOI and local administrative organizations and other government stakeholders. Level 3 Framework is implemented in selected provinces and local administrative organizations.
